üö® Purpose

This protocol fixes the "unstructured chaos" of the November 2025 legal threat.

Priority #5 Override: This suspends all Mode 1 (Solo Execution) work until the Thursday hearing is complete.

Goal: Shift the narrative, fix the "Tool Threat," and protect the kids' money. Get back to spending time with your children without this bullshit hanging over you.

üß† The Communication Barrier (What They Need to Understand)

For Mr. Welch and the court: This is not defiance. This is disability. Here's what late-diagnosed autism and ADHD actually looks like in a legal crisis.

What You See vs. What's Actually Happening

‚ùå What it looks like: "He's argumentative, aggressive, playing the system"

‚úÖ What's actually happening: When I perceive a threat to my children's stability or financial security, my brain enters a hyper-focused threat-defense mode. This is an involuntary neurological response to perceived danger, not calculated manipulation.

‚ùå What it looks like: "He won't listen, talks over people, knows everything"

‚úÖ What's actually happening: Autism causes processing delays in verbal conversation, especially under stress. By the time I've processed what you said and formulated a response, you've moved on to the next point. I interrupt not to dismiss you, but because I'm still catching up to the conversation from 30 seconds ago.

‚ùå What it looks like: "He's using AI to game the system"

‚úÖ What's actually happening: Executive dysfunction means I cannot hold complex legal procedures in my working memory while also regulating emotional responses to threats against my children. Gemini is my cognitive accommodation tool - it helps me process information at the speed the legal system demands, which my disability prevents me from doing naturally.

‚ùå What it looks like: "He needs to just calm down and cooperate"

‚úÖ What's actually happening: "Calm down" is neurologically impossible when my children's stability is threatened. My nervous system doesn't have a volume knob. The more critical the threat, the more my disability amplifies my defensive response. This isn't a choice - it's a documented symptom of my diagnosed conditions.

‚ùå What it looks like: "He's trying to delay everything with accommodations"

‚úÖ What's actually happening: I requested processing time not to stall, but because I literally cannot understand complex legal arguments in real-time verbal exchanges. My ADA accommodation request wasn't strategy - it was me trying to participate meaningfully in my own case despite my disability.

Why This Matters for Thursday

Every action I've taken - including the pro se filings that upset people - has been to protect the marital estate and my children's financial security. I was right about the RBCO preventing the 10% penalty. I was right about the financial consequences. But because my disability makes me sound aggressive when I'm actually just trying to process and respond to threats, I'm being punished for being correct.

The real issue: The opposing counsel blocked the August hardship withdrawal, preserved the foreclosure risk as leverage, misrepresented federal law about RBCOs, and then retaliated against my ADA request with punitive sanctions. But because I struggle to communicate this effectively under stress, it looks like I'm the problem.

What I Need the Court to See

I am not trying to manipulate the system. I am a father with late-diagnosed autism and ADHD trying desperately to protect my children's financial future while my disability makes every interaction with the legal system exponentially harder.

I have been the primary provider for my children their entire lives. I have created structured systems and tools (like Gemini, like this protocol) not to game anything, but to compensate for cognitive deficits that would otherwise make it impossible for me to function in crisis situations.

It's the autism. It's the ADHD. Not malice. Not manipulation. Disability under extreme stress, trying to protect my kids with a brain that doesn't work the way the legal system expects it to.

ü§ñ Gemini ‚ÄúTool Threat‚Äù Counter-Narrative

For Wednesday meeting with Mr. Welch - Read this verbatim if needed:

"The opposing counsel's request for my Gemini history is a distraction tactic. Here's the reality:

  1. Gemini is a research tool, like Westlaw or legal dictionaries. It helps me process complex information faster given my documented cognitive disabilities (ASD/ADHD).
  2. Using AI for legal research is standard practice now. Lawyers across the country use AI tools. The difference is I'm transparent about it.
  3. This is an ADA accommodation. My disability makes processing complex legal information under time pressure extremely difficult. Gemini helps me participate meaningfully in my own defense.
  4. OC's request is a fishing expedition designed to distract from the substantive issues: their financial sabotage, fraud on the court regarding the RBCO, and ADA retaliation.
  5. My proposed response: 'My use of AI research tools is protected as a reasonable accommodation under the ADA. The request is irrelevant to the substantive issues and is denied.'

Do you agree with this approach, or do you have a better strategy?"

This is Priority #5.
Everything else can wait. Protect your kids first.
